basics.Name: Mindy Zhang
basics.Summary: Researcher interested in the intersection of computer science and cognitive science.

work.name: Learning and Intelligent Systems Lab, MIT
work.summary: Researching integration of vision-language models into differentiable task and motion planning systems.
highlights: Integrated VLMs into differentiable Task and Motion Planning systems (TAMPs).
Developed differentiable cost functions from VLM outputs using PyTorch.
Prototyped small-scale tasks (object packing with constraints) for validation before scaling to real-world 3D tasks.

work.name: Nasdaq
work.position: Machine Learning and Data Science Intern
work.summary: Built machine learning systems for financial data analysis and prediction.
highlights: Developed proof of concept for OTC settlement failure prediction model using bank data.
Trained ML model achieving ~70% recall rate.
Deployed ML model on AWS EC2 and optimized data storage using AWS S3.

work.name: Computational Cognitive Science Lab, MIT
work.summary: Developed computational models of human cognition using probabilistic programming.
highlights: Coded in Julia to model moral judgment and human cognition.
Applied inference methods and numerical libraries in probabilistic modeling.
Developed, optimized, and tested models including Linear Regression and inference-based approaches.
Collaborated on academic publications with lab members.

projects.name: Leveraging Input Representations to Improve LLM Reasoning on ARC Puzzles
projects.summary: Explored how different input representations affect LLM reasoning on ARC benchmark puzzles.
highlights: Implemented strategies like grid representations, one-shot vs. zero-shot prompting, and helper functions.
Built evaluation pipeline (pixel accuracy, positional accuracy, progress metrics) to assess reasoning beyond binary correctness.
